snippet: In a referendum on April 8, 1962, French voters bowed to the inevitable by approving accords that granted Algeria self-determination. The end of the bloody Algerian war prompted an exodus of about a million French settlers. Their votes and their...
abstract: In a referendum on April 8, 1962, French voters bowed to the inevitable by approving accords that granted Algeria self-determination. The end of the bloody Algerian war prompted an exodus of about a million French settlers. Their votes and their descendents' matter.

headline.main: In Close French Election, Anniversaries on Path to Algerian Independence a Minefield
